  • Constructor Details

    • Camera

      public Camera(Point p0, Vector vto, Vector vup)
      This is the constructor of the camera. It receives 3 vectors: p0, vto and vup. The function checks if the vectors are orthogonal. If they are not, it throws an exception. If they are, it sets the vectors to the camera. Camera constructor based-on point and 2 vectors
      Parameters:
      p0 - Point position
      vto - Vector
      vup - Vector

      Parameters:

      Returns:
      The camera object itself.

    • setAntiAliasing

      public Camera setAntiAliasing(boolean antiAliasing)
      This function sets the anti-aliasing boolean to the value of the parameter antiAliasing.
      Parameters:
      antiAliasing - If true, the camera will use anti-aliasing.
      Returns:
      The camera object itself.

      public Camera setDepthOfField(boolean depthOfField)
      This function sets the depth of field to true or false.
      Parameters:

      The camera object itself.

      public Camera setNumOfRaysDepth(int numOfRaysDepth)
      Sets the number of rays to be used for depth calculation.

      The camera itself.

    • constructRay

      public Ray constructRay(int nX, int nY, int j, int i)
      The function constructs a ray through pixel (i,j) on the view plane
      Parameters:
      nX - number of pixels in the x direction
      nY - number of pixels in the vertical direction
      j - the column of the pixel in the image
      i - the row index of the pixel in the image
      Returns:
      A ray from the camera to the pixel.

      public void renderImage2()

      public void renderImage()
      Render the image by writing every pixel of the grid Use of AntiAliasing method that is shooting lots of beams in place of only one in the center of the pixel

    • constructCenterCornersRaysFromRay

      public List<Ray> constructCenterCornersRaysFromRay(Ray myRay, double nX, double nY)
      Function that gets a pixel's center ray and constructs a list of 5 rays from that ray, one at each corner of the pixel and one in the center
      Parameters:
      myRay - the center's ray
      nX - number of pixel in width
      nY - number of pixels in height
      Returns:
      list of rays

    • constructCenterOfEdgesRays

      public List<Ray> constructCenterOfEdgesRays(Ray ray, double nX, double nY)
      It takes a ray and a pixel, and returns the 4 rays that go through the edges of the pixel
      Parameters:
      ray - the ray that goes through the center of the pixel
      nX - number of pixels in the X axis
      nY - the number of pixels in the vertical direction
      Returns:
      The rays that are being returned are the rays that are being sent from the camera to the focal field.

    • averageColor

      public Color averageColor(Color color, int len)
      Given a color and a length, return the average color of the color and the length.
      Parameters:
      color - The color to average
      len - the length of the array
      Returns:
      The average color of the pixels in the image.

    • constructRays

      public HashSet<Ray> constructRays(int nX, int nY, int j, int i)

    • constructPixelCenterRay

      public Ray constructPixelCenterRay(Ray ray, double nX, double nY)
      Construct ray through the center of a pixel when we have only the bottom right corner's ray
      Parameters:
      ray - the ray
      nX - number of pixel in width
      nY - number of pixels in height
      Returns:
      center's ray

    • constructRayThroughPixel

      public Ray constructRayThroughPixel(int nX, int nY, double j, double i)
      The function constructs a ray from Camera location through the center of a pixel (i,j) in the view plane
      Parameters:
      nX - number of pixels in a row of view plane
      nY - number of pixels in a column of view plane
      j - number of the pixel in a row
      i - number of the pixel in a column
      Returns:
      the ray through pixel's center
